task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 322°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current pitch of 0° may not capture the full height of the building; rotating upward will reveal the roofline to measure from ground to top.
The current heading (0°N) no longer faces the target building at 322°NW; rotating left by 38° will realign the view to face the building while maintaining the upward pitch to observe its full height.
The current pitch of 0° does not show the building's roof; rotating upward by 30° will align the view to capture the full height from ground to roof for estimation.

The current heading (0°N) is misaligned with the target building at 322°NW; rotating left by 38° will reorient to face the building while maintaining the upward pitch to observe its full height for estimation.
The building's full height is now visible after aligning the view at 322° with upward pitch; estimating based on typical building proportions and visible scale, the height is approximately 15 meters.
